member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadBarcode25Interleaved
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 is a higher-density numeric bar code based upon the Standard 2 of 5. Interleaved 2 of 5 encodes any even number of numeric characters in the widths of the bars and spaces of the bar code. Unlike Standard 2 of 5, which only encodes information in the width of the bars, Interleaved 2 of 5 encodes data in the width of both the bars and spaces. This allows Interleaved 2 of 5 to achieve a somewhat higher density. The code is called "interleaved" because the first numeric data is encoded in the first 5 bars while the second numeric data is encoded in the first 5 spaces that separate the first 5 bars. Thus the first 5 bars and spaces actually encode two characters. This is also why the bar code can only encode an even number of data elements.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Creates a path figure collection for a RadBarcode type.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadBarcode25Standard
member.summary: Standard 2 of 5 is a low-density numeric bar code. The spaces in the barcode exist only to separate the bars themselves. Additionally, a bar may either be wide or narrow, a wide bar generally being 3 times as wide as a narrow bar. The exact size of the spaces is not critical, but is generally the same width as a narrow bar.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadBarcode93
member.summary: Code 93 was designed to complement and improve upon Code 39. Code 93 is similar in that it, like Code 39, can represent the full ASCII character set by using combinations of 2 characters. It differs in that Code 93 is a continuous barcode and produces denser code. It also encodes 47 characters compared to Code 39's 43 characters.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.MapLogicalToPhysicalValue(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a logical value from a value range to some kind of physical value in another range.
member.param: The difference of the min and max values of the expected metric's range.
The difference between the min and max values.
member.returns: Returns a physical value that corresponds to the logical value in the physical value's respective range.
member.remarks: The other physical value can be an angle in the radial range and a distance in the linear range. For example a value in the min/max value range can be converted to an angle in min/max angle range or to a distance in the min/max distance range.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.TickStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the tick step.
member.remarks: The tick step is used to determine how the range ticks are spread over the value range. In other words, it determines how many ticks will be created.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.LabelStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the label step.
member.remarks: This step used to determine how the range labels will be spread over the value range.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.MiddleTickStep
member.summary: Gets or sets a step that is used to determine which ticks will be middle ticks.
member.remarks: This step is used on top of the number of created ticks, not the value range. Middle ticks will use the middle tick template.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.MajorTickStep
member.summary: Gets or sets a step that is used to determine which ticks will be major ticks.
member.remarks: This step is used on top of the number of created ticks, not the value range. Major ticks will use the major tick template.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the minor ticks.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.MiddleTickTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the middle ticks.
member.remarks: If this is null, the minor template will be used instead.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GaugeRange.MajorTickTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the major ticks.
member.remarks: If this is null, the minor template will be used instead.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.CenterMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the CenterMode. This property determines where is the center of the ticks, labels and indicators in the range relative to the layout rectangle.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.MaxAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angle of this range.
member.remarks: The maximum angle does not restrict the indicators, only the ticks and the labels.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.MinAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum angle of this range.
member.remarks: The minimum angle does not restrict the indicators, only the ticks and the labels.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.TickRadiusScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a scale factor that will be multiplied by the radius of this range in order to position the ticks.
member.remarks: Setting this property to 1 will cause the ticks to be placed as far away from the center as possible. Setting it to 0 will cause all ticks to be placed at the center. The radius of the range is half the value of the minimum between the width and height of the layout slot.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.LabelRadiusScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a scale factor that will be multiplied by the radius of this range in order to position the labels.
member.remarks: Setting this property to 1 will cause the labels to be placed as far away from the center as possible. Setting it to 0 will cause all labels to be placed at the center. The radius of the range is half the value of the minimum between the width and height of the layout slot.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.SweepDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the sweep direction of the ticks and the labels.
member.remarks: This is also an attached property and can be used to modify the indicators in the radial range.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadialGaugeRange.RangeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of this range. For this class it is always Radial.
